57. So the mass of the sample will be reduced to 5 mg after about 57 years.
Of all possible bases for an exponential function, there is one that is most convenient
for the purposes of calculus. The choice of a base
is in²uenced by the way the graph
-axis. Figures 13 and 14 show the tangent lines to the graphs of
. (Tangent lines will be deIned precisely in Section
2.7. For present purposes, you can think of the tangent line to an exponential graph at a
point as the line that touches the graph only at that point.) ±f we measure the slopes of
±t turns out, as we will see in Chapter 3, that some of the formulas of calculus will be
greatly simpliIed if we choose the base
